title: Drawing, "Costume Design for Mistress Page for the Production of "The Merry Wives of Windsor"", ca. 1927
medium: Graphite, brush and watercolor on illustration board
markings: verso: stamped in blue ink, center: THIS DRAWING IS MY PERSONAL PROPERTY / AND MUST BE RETURNED TO ME / HENRY DREYFUSS / SEP 30 1927 / logo of Scenic Artists Union Local 829; printed in brown ink, upper left: Drawing Board / City / HP (hot pressed) for pen-and-ink, CP (cold pressed) / Special Surfaces Nos 1 & 2 for Wash Drawings
signed: marking pen and black ink, top left: Henry Dreyfuss.
inscribed:
recto: in pen and black ink on off-white wove paper pasted to board, bottom right: PRODUCTION OF / THE MERRY WIVES OF WINDSOR / COSTUME FOR MISTRESS PAGE / PLAYED BY MRS. FISKE / 1927.

verso, top left, clockwise from top left: in pen and blue ink: DPE - 18 - E / in graphite: 3 f---- (indecipherable) / (in graphite) 3/4 E- / stamped in black ink: CP / in pen and black ink: 3;  verso, in graphite, across top: 10" x 15" /
creditline: Gift of University of California, Los Angeles

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Costume Design for Mistress Page for the Production of "The Merry Wives of Windsor"", ca. 1927.
ca. 1927. Graphite, brush and watercolor on illustration board. Gift of University of California, Los Angeles. 1973-15-124.
